title: مَا الْكَافَّةُ وَالْمَكْفُوفَةُ
description: Learn about ما الكافّة - the ما that attaches to certain particles (إنّ، أنّ، ربّ، كأنّ) and neutralizes their grammatical governance, allowing them to be followed by sentences.

notes.title: What is ما الكافّة?
content: مَا الْكَافَّة is a مَا that attaches to certain particles and 'neutralizes' (كَفَّ) their grammatical governance. The particle becomes 'مَكْفُوفَة' (neutralized/restrained).
Before مَا: إِنَّ requires اسم + خبر. After مَا: إِنَّمَا can be followed by a complete sentence (جُمْلَة) without governing any word.

examples.english: Many a truthful man (ربّ governs jarr)

notes.title: إنَّما - Restriction
content: إِنَّمَا is the most common كَافَّة-مَكْفُوفَة construction. While إِنَّ emphasizes certainty, إِنَّمَا expresses restriction (حَصْر): 'only/nothing but.'
After إِنَّمَا, you can have a nominal sentence (جُمْلَة اسْمِيَّة) or verbal sentence (جُمْلَة فِعْلِيَّة) - the governance of إِنَّ is cancelled.
keyPoints: Can follow: nominal or verbal sentence

examples.arabic: إِنَّمَا يَخْشَى اللهَ مِنْ عِبَادِهِ الْعُلَمَاءُ

notes.title: رُبَّما - Probability
content: رُبَّ is a preposition meaning 'many a' and requires a مَجْرُور (genitive noun). When مَا attaches, رُبَّمَا means 'perhaps/maybe' and can be followed by a verb.
رُبَّمَا is commonly followed by a past tense verb (فِعْل مَاضٍ) or present tense (مُضَارِع). The particle no longer governs jarr.

examples.english: Perhaps those who disbelieved will wish... (Quran 15:2)

notes.title: كَأَنَّما - Comparison
content: كَأَنَّ is used for comparison/simile and requires اسْم + خَبَر. When مَا attaches, كَأَنَّمَا can be followed by a sentence without governing.
كَأَنَّمَا is often followed by a verbal sentence, especially in Quranic usage, maintaining the comparative meaning but with greater flexibility.

examples.english: As if they are being driven to death (Quran 8:6)
As if their faces are covered (Quran 10:27)
As if he is climbing in the sky
As if he killed all people (Quran 5:32)

notes.title: Other كافّة Constructions
content: Other particles can also take ما الكافّة: لَيْتَمَا (if only), لَعَلَّمَا (perhaps), though these are less common than إِنَّمَا and رُبَّمَا.
The prepositions بَعْدَ and قَبْلَ can also take ما: بَعْدَمَا، قَبْلَمَا، حَيْثُمَا. In these, ما is sometimes called مَوْصُولَة rather than كَافَّة.

examples.english: Wherever you may be, Allah will bring you

notes.title: Grammatical Analysis
content: When analyzing sentences with ما الكافّة, the particle + ما is treated as a unit. The following sentence is analyzed independently (not as اسم and خبر of the particle).
إِنَّمَا زَيْدٌ قَائِمٌ: زيدٌ = مبتدأ، قائمٌ = خبر. The original إنّ structure is completely neutralized.

examples.arabic: إِنَّمَا يَفْعَلُ ذٰلِكَ: يفعل = فعل مضارع

exercises.prompt: الْحَرْفُ الَّذِي دَخَلَتْ عَلَيْهِ مَا الْكَافَّةُ يُسَمَّى _____
exercises.promptEn: The particle that ما الكافّة enters upon is called _____
إنّما المؤمنون إخوة - المؤمنون here is _____
